moves.2... e6 3. d4 cxd4 4. cxd4 a6: 1st mistake :wasting one time. Center needs to be whether reconquered or attacked, for example d4 transposes to french opening. No need to be scared of Bb5+.
moves.5. Nf3 Nc6 6. Bd3 d6: Now it looks like black only want to defend. White will sure attack ! Again d4 would be better.
moves.7... h6: losing one tempo again. White is now a lot ahead in development.
moves.8. Nc3 Qc7:
why this move ?
2 bishops and 1 noble haven't moved yet, Knight are completely stuck.
moves.9. Bf4: move that pawn if you dare now.
moves.9... e5 10. dxe5 dxe5 11. Nd5: Queen's got nowhere nice to go.
moves.11... Qa5 12. Nxe5: white wants the center and gets it.
moves.12... Nxe5: necessary in this case but still an awful move.
moves.13. Bxe5 Ra7:
??
I still have no idea why that roque came here !?!
moves.14. Bc3: where can that queen go now ?
moves.15... Nf6: only one pawn ahead but the position is just so comfortable. Exchange the noble and get that e-pawn out of the way is sure to win.
moves.17... Be6: This would have been good, just too late.
